content.title: Uses
content.description: Grown for its timber and checks the wind velocity in coastal area to minimize the adverse effects of cyclones. Leaves of young plants are used as a fodder for cattle. Leaves (also called needles) are rich in lignocellulose. Needles have the potential to the dyes, rhodomine B, methyl violet 2B, from textile effluents and thus reduce water pollution. Activated carbon of seed husk has the ability to removal the toxic chromium VI [Cr(VI)] from the solutions.
